greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 7^A000120(n).
comment: It appears that when A151785 is regarded as a triangle in which the row lengths are the powers of 2, this is what the rows converge to.
Also this is also a row of the square array A256140.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Catalog of Toothpick and Cellular Automata Sequences in the OEIS
Index entries for sequences related to cellular automata
example: Also, written as an irregular triangle in which the row lengths are the terms of A011782, the sequence begins:
